Title: Bindery.js
Subtitle: A tool that converts *html* projects into print ready files
Notes (need to edit in accordance to our: Bindery.js is a JavaScript library designed to facilitate the creation of print-ready books directly within a web browser. It allows web designers and developers to structure and format content for print, including features like page breaks, footnotes, tables of contents, and indexes, using HTML and CSS. examples of work here https://bindery.info/gallery/

Title: Paged Js
Subtitle: A tool that converts html projects into print ready files
Notes (need to edit in accordance to our: Paged.js is a free and open source JavaScript library that paginates content in the browser to create PDF output from any HTML content. This means you can design works for print (eg. books) using HTML and CSS! Paged.js follows the Paged Media standards published by the W3C (ie the Paged Media Module, and the Generated Content for Paged Media Module). In effect Paged.js acts as a polyfill for the CSS modules to print content using features that are not yet natively supported by browsers. Paged.js is a community driven project, we‚Äôll make sure that anyone feels just like at home, newcomers and old friends alike. We‚Äôll always put the community needs first: we have a Mattermost that we use to discuss everything and the development is hosted on github. All the issues are read and answered as fast as possible.

Title: Weasy print
Subtitle: A tool that converts html projects into statistical reports, tickets or invoices
Notes (need to edit in accordance to our: WeasyPrint is a smart solution helping web developers to create PDF documents. It‚Äôs free and open source software that can be easily plugged to your applications and websites and turns simple HTML pages into gorgeous statistical reports, invoices and tickets

Title: Artivive
Subtitle: A tool for AR image overlays
Notes (need to edit in accordance to our: Artivive is an AR tool that allows artists to create new dimensions of art by linking classical with digital art. The digital layer opens doors to a whole new world of possibilities. Artists can take visitors on a journey through time, explain what lies underneath, enhance the art with animations, or show how the artworks were made.

Title: Lulu
Subtitle: Print on demand platform
Notes (need to edit in accordance to our: Lulu Press, Inc., doing business under trade name Lulu, is an online print-on-demand, self-publishing, and distribution platform. By 2014, it had issued approximately two million titles.[1]

Title: Pandoc
Subtitle: File converter
Notes (need to edit in accordance to our: Pandoc is a tool to convert one file format to another, like markdown, html, docx, rtf, txt, epub, LaTeX, PDF and many others.

Title: Self hosting guide
Notes (need to edit in accordance to our: This guide focuses on the relatively simple method (as opposed to a more comprehensive ‚Äúhomelab‚Äù running services like Nextcloud‚Äîexplained in our separate guide), which uses a Linux computer that could be your old laptop you always keep powered on or an old desktop PC, mini-PC, a single board computer like a Raspberry Pi, or anything that can run Linux and has enough juice to run two Docker containers.

Title: Print Are.na
Subtitle: A tool that converts [are.na](https://are.na) boards into print ready files
Notes (need to edit in accordance to our: print.are.na was created by Mindy Seu, Charles Broskoski and Ekene Ijeoma. print.are.na uses bindery.js, an open-source library for creating books using HTML and CSS, created by Evan Brooks. The first version print.are.na was created by Callil Capuozzo for the 2017 Cybernetics Conference.

Title: Spectrolite
Subtitle: Riso printing channel seperator
Notes (need to edit in accordance to our:
Spectrolite is a free Mac desktop app by ANEMONE to make colorful üåà risograph prints and zines more easily.
Riso-ify your images! Spectrolite lets you do color separation for risograph, to make the greyscale files that the printer uses to make the stencil(s) for each ink color. Change opacity, or switch styles to halftone or posterize your artwork. Or preview a greyscale file as a single ink color. You can export PSD files to edit further with channels or levels, or place into InDesign.

Title: Binder
Subtitle: A tool for web compositing (not sure this is the right word)
Author/Publisher: This is our work and Clement Valla
Notes (need to edit in accordance to our: We wanted to design a website that is a simple navigation layer on top of an already-existing web format ‚Äî and made this idea usable with the full Google suite, and also Tumblr, PDF‚Äôs, Wikipedia, YouTube. Binder isn‚Äôt a holder of content but a link, or a hub, that binds other sites together.
